page.title: 05FARMING PROBLEMS -NORTHWOLD
page.content: The soil in the area is light and sandy,consequently drought and wind erosion are severe problems.To lessen the effects of wind erosion,some farmers spray their fields with chemicals to 'seal' the surface.This treatment will last 8-12 weeks. The soil tends to be high in phosphates and low in potash.Fertility is improved by adding various minerals and spraying with liquid fertilizers. The summer of 1985 was wet and windy with lower temperatures than usual. This has made it a bad year for farmers.One farmer estimated that out of 120 acres of corn only 7-8 acres remained standing ready for the harvest - the rest was flattened by the rain,hail and gale force winds. Cereals have required more drying than usual which results in at least a 4% weight loss.
